definition: lit. to take off a hat/fig. to be cleared of an unfair charge/rehabilitation
to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)
lit. to take off a hat/fig. to be cleared of an unfair charge/rehabilitation

sentences.english: The skinny man said he was more polite because he always tipped his hat to ladies.
sentences.chinese: 瘦子说他更有礼貌，因为他经常对女士摘帽示意。

sentences.english: Never bow to authority, but always tip your hat.
sentences.chinese: 永不向权势低头，但要摘帽为礼。

sentences.english: Susan is taking off her hat to the judges and riding out of the ring.
sentences.chinese: 苏姗向裁判摘帽致意，然后骑出了赛场。

definition: to make good a deficit/to reverse a loss
achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
to lift oneself out of poverty
slab/(geology) tectonic plate/(fig.) sector (of the stock market or of industry)/(economic) bloc
